title: 107_s1210
content: The curr_chunk is a section header titled "SHORT TITLE." The Act is named the "Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002." It reauthorizes the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996, extending block grants and federal guarantees until 2007. The American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to extend provisions until 2007, including the Indian Housing Loan Guarantee Fund. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a definition for "housing related community development," which refers to tribally-owned facilities or infrastructure that aid in the construction of reservation housing. This definition excludes activities under the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act. SEC. 4. Amends the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 to include comprehensive housing and community development planning activities. SEC. 5. Addresses the treatment of program income and labor standards. Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include provisions regarding the utilization of income for housing-related activities. Subsection (a)(2) is also modified to address restricted access or reduction in income. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include provisions on the utilization of income for housing-related activities, including whether the recipient has used retained program income for such activities. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include provisions on the utilization of income for housing-related activities. SEC. 6. REGULATIONS. Section 106(b)(2)(A) of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include regulations required under the Act, including any future amendments. Section 601 is amended to include housing-related community development activities. Feasibility studies are proposed to enhance housing assistance in Native communities. SEC. 8. Feasibility studies to improve housing assistance in Native communities by establishing a demonstration project for tribes to design and operate community development projects. The Secretary is required to conduct a study and submit it to relevant committees regarding the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to receive assistance under the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act. Organizations authorized to receive assistance should prioritize tribal authority in Federal housing funding. The Secretary must conduct a study and submit it to relevant committees within a year. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must complete a study on black mold infestation in Native American housing within 180 days of this Act and submit recommendations to Congress.
